   20: -module(zip_SUITE).

   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, borderline/1, atomic/1,
   24:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   25:          zip_to_binary/1,
   26:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   27:          openzip_api/1, zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   28: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   29:          compress_control/1,
   30: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   31:          explicit_file_info/1]).
   32: 
   33: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   34: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   38: 
   39: all() -> 
   40:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   41:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   42:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases, openzip_api,
   43:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   44:      unzip_traversal_exploit,fd_leak,unicode,test_zip_dir,
   45:      explicit_file_info].
   46: 
   47: groups() -> 
   48:     [].
   49: 
   50: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   54:     ok.
   55: 
   56: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: 
   63: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
   64: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
   65: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
   66: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   67:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   68:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
   69:     ok = file:make_dir(TempDir),
   70: 
   71:     Record = 512,
   72:     Block = 20 * Record,
   73: 
   74:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
   75:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
   76:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
   77:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
   78:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
   79: 
   80:     %% Clean up.
   81:     delete_files([TempDir]),
   82:     ok.
   83: 
   84: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
   85:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
   86:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
   87:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
   88: 
   89:     %% Create a file and archive it.
   90:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
   91:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
   92:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
   93:     ok = file:delete(Name),
   94: 
   95:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
   96:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
   97:           #zip_file{name = Name,
   98:                     info = Info,
   99:                     offset = 0,
  100:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  101:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  102:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  103: 
  104:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  105:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  106:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  107: 
  108: 
  109:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  110:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  111: 
  112:     ok.
  113: 
  114: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  115:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  116:         true ->
  117:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  118:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  119:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  120:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  121:         _ ->
  122:             ok
  123:     end.
  124: 
  125: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  126:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  127: 
  128: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  129:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  130:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  131: 
  132: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  133:     receive
  134:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  135:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  136:         {Port, eof} ->
  137:             Port ! {self(), close},
  138:             receive
  139:                 {Port, closed} ->
  140:                     true
  141:             end,
  142:             receive
  143:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  144:                     ok
  145:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  146:                     ok
  147:             end,
  148:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  152:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  153: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  154:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  155: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  156:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  157: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  158:     ok.
  159: 
  160: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  161:     unlink(Port),
  162:     exit(Port, die),
  163:     ct:fail(Reason).
  164: 
  165: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  166:     Cmd.
  167: %%     case os:type() of
  168: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  169: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  170: %%     end.
  171: 
  172: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  173: 
  174: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  175:     X = next_random(X0),
  176:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  177:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  178:         _ -> false
  179:     end;
  180: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  181:     true.
  182: 
  183: %% Generates a random byte list.
  184: 
  185: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  186:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  187: 
  188: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  189:     X = next_random(X0),
  190:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  191: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  192:     lists:reverse(Result).
  193: 
  194: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  195: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  196: 
  197: next_random(X) ->
  198:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  199: 
  200: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  201: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  202: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  203:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  204:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  205:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  206:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  207: 
  208:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  209: 
  210:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  211:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  212:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  213: 
  214:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  215: 
  216:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  217:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  218:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  219:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  220: 
  221:     %% Clean up.
  222:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  223: 
  224:     ok.
  225: 
  226: %% Test the openzip_open/2, openzip_get/1, openzip_get/2, openzip_close/1
  227: %% and openzip_list_dir/1 functions.
  228: openzip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  229:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  230:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  231:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  232:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  233: 
  234:     %% Create a zip archive
  235: 
  236:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  237:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  238: 
  239:     %% Open archive
  240:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:openzip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  241: 
  242:     %% List dir
  243:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:openzip_list_dir(OpenZip)),
  244: 
  245:     %% Get a file
  246:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  247:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  248:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:openzip_get(Name1, OpenZip),
  249: 
  250:     %% Get all files
  251:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  252:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  253:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:openzip_get(OpenZip),
  254: 
  255:     %% Close
  256:     ok = zip:openzip_close(OpenZip),
  257: 
  258:     %% Clean up.
  259:     delete_files([Names]),
  260: 
  261:     ok.
  262: 
  263: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  264: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  265: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  266:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  267:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  268:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  269:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  270: 
  271:     %% Create a zip archive
  272:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  273:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  274: 
  275:     %% Open archive
  276:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  277: 
  278:     %% List dir
  279:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  280: 
  281:     %% Get a file
  282:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  283:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  284:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  285:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  286:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  287: 
  288:     %% Get all files
  289:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  290:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  291:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  292: 
  293:     %% Close
  294:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  295: 
  296:     %% Clean up.
  297:     delete_files([Names]),
  298: 
  299:     ok.
  300: 
  301: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  302: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  303: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  304: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  305:     %% Create a zip archive
  306:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  307:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  308: 
  309:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  310:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  311: 
  312:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  313:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  314: 
  315:     %% Clean up.
  316:     delete_files([Zip]),
  317: 
  318:     ok.
  319: 
  320: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  321:     Self = self(),
  322:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  323:     receive
  324:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  325:             ZipSrv
  326:     end.
  327: 
  328: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  329:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  330:     receive
  331:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  332:             true
  333:     after 1000 ->
  334:             false
  335:     end.
  336: 
  337: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  338: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  339:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  340:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  341:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  342: 
  343:     %% create a temp directory
  344:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  345:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  346: 
  347:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  348: 
  349:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  350:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  351: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  352: 
  353:     %% Verify.
  354:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  355:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  356: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  357: 		  FList),
  358:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  359: 		  RetList),
  360: 
  361:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  362:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  363:     ok.
  364: 
  365: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  366: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  367:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  368:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  369:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  370: 
  371:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  372:     %% clash.txt
  373:     %% ../clash.txt
  374:     %% ../above.txt
  375:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  376: 
  377:     %% create a temp directory
  378:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  379:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  380:     
  381:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  382:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  383:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  384: 
  385:     %% unzip in SubDir
  386:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  387: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  388: 
  389:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  390: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  391:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  392:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  393: 
  394:     %% clean up
  395:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  396:     
  397:      %% create the temp directory again
  398:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  399: 
  400:     %% unzip in SubDir
  401:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  402: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  403: 
  404:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  405: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  406:    
  407:     %% clean up
  408:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  409:     ok.
  410: 
  411: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  412: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  413:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  414:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  415:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  416: 
  417:     %% create a temp directory
  418:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  419:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  420:     ok = file:set_cwd(Subdir),
  421: 
  422:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  423: 
  424:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile),
  425: 
  426:     %% Verify.
  427:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  428: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  429: 		  FList),
  430:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  431: 		  RetList),
  432: 
  433:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  434:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  435:     ok.
  436: 
  437: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  438: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  439:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  440:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  441:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  442:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  443: 
  444:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  445:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  446: 
  447:     %% Create a zip archive
  448:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  449:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  450: 
  451:     %% Open archive
  452:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  453: 
  454:     %% List dir
  455:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  456: 
  457:     %% Get a file
  458:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  459:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  460:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  461: 
  462:     %% Get all files
  463:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  464:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  465:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  466: 
  467:     %% Close
  468:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  469: 
  470:     %% Clean up.
  471:     delete_files([Names]),
  472: 
  473:     ok.
  474: 
  475: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  476: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  477:     ok.
  478: 
  479: 
  480: 
  481: 
  482: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  483: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  484:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  485: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  486:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  487:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  488: 
  489: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  490: char_seq(N, First) ->
  491:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  492: 
  493: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  494:     Result;
  495: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  496:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  497: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  498:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  499: 
  500: data_files() ->
  501:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  502:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  503:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  504:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  505:     create_files(Files),
  506:     Files.
  507: 
  508: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  509:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  510:     create_files(Rest);
  511: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  512:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  513:     create_files(Rest);
  514: create_files([]) ->
  515:     ok.
  516: 
  517: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], []) ->
  518: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  519: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Dir);
  520: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], Parent) ->
  521: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  522: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  523: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  524: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  525: %%     Dir.
  526: 
  527: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  528: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  529:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  530:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  531:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  532:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  533:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  534:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  535:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  536:                           {ok, O} = zip:openzip_open(A, []),
  537:                           zip:openzip_get("not_here", O)
  538:                   end,
  539:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  540:     ok.
  541: 
  542: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  543:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  544:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  545: 
  546: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  547:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  548: 
  549:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  550:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  551:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  552:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  553:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  554:     case What(Full) of
  555:         Expected ->
  556:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  557:         Other ->
  558:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  559:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  560:     end.
  561: 
  562: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  563: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  564:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  565:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  566:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  567:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  568: 
  569:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  570:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  571: 
  572:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  573:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  574: 
  575:     %% Verify.
  576:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) -> {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  577:                   end, FBList),
  578: 
  579:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  580:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  581: 
  582:     ok.
  583: 
  584: %% Test compressing to binary with memory option.
  585: zip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  586:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  587:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  588:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "zip_to_binary"),
  589:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  590: 
  591:     file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  592:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  593:     ZipName = "t.zip",
  594:     FilePath = filename:join(DataDir, FileName),
  595:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(FilePath, FileName),
  596: 
  597:     %% Zip to a binary archive
  598:     {ok, {ZipName, ZipB}} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName], [memory]),
  599: 
  600:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  601:     {ok,[FileName]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  602: 
  603:     %% Zip to a file
  604:     {ok, ZipName} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName]),
  605: 
  606:     %% Verify.
  607:     {ok, ZipB} = file:read_file(ZipName),
  608:     {ok, FData} = file:read_file(FileName),
  609:     {ok, [{FileName, FData}]} = zip:unzip(ZipB, [memory]),
  610: 
  611:     %% Clean up.
  612:     delete_files([FileName, ZipName]),
  613: 
  614:     ok.
  615: 
  616: %% Test using the aliases, extract/2, table/2 and create/3.
  617: aliases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  618:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  619:     Size = 100,
  620:     B = list_to_binary(random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  621:     %% create
  622:     {ok, {"z.zip", ZArchive}} = zip:create("z.zip", [{"b", B}], [memory]),
  623:     %% extract
  624:     {ok, [{"b", B}]} = zip:extract(ZArchive, [memory]),
  625:     %% table
  626:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = _}, #zip_file{name = "b",
  627:                                                info = FI,
  628:                                                comp_size = _,
  629:                                                offset = 0}]} =
  630:         zip:table(ZArchive),
  631:     Size = FI#file_info.size,
  632: 
  633:     ok.
  634: 
  635: 
  636: 
  637: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  638: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  639:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  640:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  641:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  642:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  643:     Archive = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.zip"),
  644:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"), Archive),
  645:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  646:     Quote = "quotes/rain.txt",
  647:     Wikipedia = "wikipedia.txt",
  648:     EmptyFile = "emptyFile",
  649:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  650: 
  651:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary.
  652:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Archive),
  653:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]} = zip:unzip(Bin),
  654: 
  655:     %% Verify.
  656:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  657:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  658:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  659: 
  660:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  661:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  662:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  663: 
  664:     %% Clean up.
  665:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  666:     ok.
  667: 
  668: %% oac_files() ->
  669: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  670: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  671: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  672: %%     create_files(Files),
  673: %%     Files.
  674: 
  675: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  676: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  677: delete_files(List) ->
  678:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  679: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  680:     Cnt;
  681: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  682:     case file:delete(Item) of
  683:         ok ->
  684:             DelCnt = 1;
  685:         {error,eperm} ->
  686:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  687:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  688:             file:del_dir(Item);
  689:         {error,eacces} ->
  690:             %% We'll see about that!
  691:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  692:             case file:delete(Item) of
  693:                 ok ->
  694: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  695:                 {error,_} ->
  696:                     erlang:yield(),
  697:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  698:                     file:delete(Item),
  699:                     DelCnt = 1
  700:             end;
  701:         {error,_} ->
  702:             DelCnt = 0
  703:     end,
  704:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  705: 
  706: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  707: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  708:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  709:     Dir = "compress_control",
  710:     Files = [
  711:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  712:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  713:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  714:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  715:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  716:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  717:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  718:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  719:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  720:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  721:             ],
  722: 
  723:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  724: 			  Files,
  725: 			  [{compress, []}],
  726: 			  []),
  727: 
  728:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  729: 			  Files,
  730: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  731: 			  []),
  732: 
  733:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  734: 			  Files,
  735: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  736: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  737: 
  738:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  739: 			  Files,
  740: 			  [],
  741: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  742: 
  743:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  744: 			  Files,
  745: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  746: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  747: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  748: 
  749:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  750: 			  Files,
  751: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  752: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  753: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  754: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  755: 
  756:     ok.
  757: 
  758: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  759:     %% Cleanup
  760:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  761:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  762:     delete_files([Zip]),
  763:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  764: 
  765:     create_files(Files),
  766:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  767: 
  768:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:openzip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  769:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:openzip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  770:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  771:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  772:     ok = zip:openzip_close(OpenZip),
  773: 
  774:     %% Cleanup
  775:     delete_files([Zip]),
  776:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  777: 
  778:     ok.
  779: 
  780: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  781:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  782:         case Kind of
  783:             dir ->
  784:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  785:             _   ->
  786:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:openzip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  787:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  788:         end,
  789:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  790:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  791: 
  792:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  793:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  794:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  795:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  796:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  797:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  798:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  799:     end,
  800:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  801: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  802:     ok.
  803: 
  804: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  805:     false;
  806: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  807:     CompressOpt =
  808:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  809:             [] -> all;
  810:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  811:         end,
  812:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  813:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  814:     UncompressOpt =
  815:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  816:             [] -> Default;
  817:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  818:         end,
  819:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  820:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  821: 
  822: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  823:     case H of
  824:         all ->
  825:             extensions(T, H);
  826:         H when is_list(H) ->
  827:             extensions(T, H);
  828:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  829:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  830:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  831:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  832:         _ ->
  833:             extensions(T, Old)
  834:     end;
  835: extensions([], Old) ->
  836:     Old.
  837: 
  838: foldl(Config) ->
  839:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  840:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  841: 
  842:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  843:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  844:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  845:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory]),
  846:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  847:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  848:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  849:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory]),
  850:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  851: 	try
  852: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
  853: 	catch
  854: 	    throw:FooBin ->
  855: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
  856: 	end,
  857:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  858:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  859: 
  860:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
  861:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
  862:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
  863: 
  864:     ok = file:delete(File),
  865:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  866: 
  867:     ok.
  868: 
  869: fd_leak(Config) ->
  870:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  871:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  872:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
  873:     BadExtract = fun() ->
  874:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
  875:                          ok
  876:                  end,
  877:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
  878: 
  879:     BadCreate = fun() ->
  880:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
  881:                                                  ["none"]),
  882:                         ok
  883:                 end,
  884:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
  885: 
  886:     ok.
  887: 
  888: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
  889:     ok;
  890: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
  891:     try Bad() of
  892:         ok ->
  893:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
  894:     catch
  895:         C:R:Stk ->
  896:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
  897:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
  898:     end.
  899: 
  900: unicode(Config) ->
  901:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
  902:         latin1 ->
  903:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
  904:         utf8 ->
  905:             DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  906:             ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  907:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
  908:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
  909:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
  910:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
  911:             case has_zip() of
  912:                 false ->
  913:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
  914:                 true ->
  915:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
  916:                         true ->
  917:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
  918:                             ok;
  919:                         false ->
  920:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
  921:                     end
  922:             end
  923:     end.
  924: 
  925: test_filename_compatibility() ->
  926:     FancyName = "üñíĉòdë한",
  927:     Archive = "test.zip",
  928: 
  929:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
  930:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
  931: 
  932: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
  933:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
  934:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
  935:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
  936:     [begin
  937:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
  938:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
  939:      end ||
  940:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
  941:     ok.
  942: 
  943: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
  944:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
  945:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
  946:               [FileName, Comment]),
  947:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  948:     {ok, Archive} =
  949:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
  950:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
  951: 
  952: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
  953:     case test_zip1() of
  954:         false ->
  955:             ok;
  956:         true ->
  957:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
  958:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
  959:                       [FileName, Comment]),
  960:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  961:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
  962:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
  963:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
  964:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
  965:     end.
  966: 
  967: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
  968:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
  969:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
  970:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
  971:     ok.
  972: 
  973: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
  974:     case test_zip1() of
  975:         false ->
  976:             ok;
  977:         true ->
  978:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
  979:             FileName = "a.txt",
  980:             Comment = [Char],
  981:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
  982:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  983: 
  984:             {ok, _} =
  985:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
  986:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
  987:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
  988:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
  989: 
  990:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
  991:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
  992:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
  993:     end.
  994: 
  995: test_zip1() ->
  996:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
  997: 
  998: has_zip() ->
  999:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
 1000: 
 1001: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1002:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1003:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1004: 
 1005: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1006:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1007:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1008:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1009:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1010:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1011:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1012:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1013:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1014:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1015:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1016:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1017:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1018:     ok.
 1019: 
 1020: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1021:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1022:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1023:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1024:     Comment = [9999999],
 1025:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1026:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1027: 
 1028: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1029:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1030:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1031:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1032:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1033: 
 1034: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1035:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1036:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1037:             DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1038:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1039:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1040:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1041:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1042:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1043:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1044:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1045:             ok;
 1046:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1047:     end.
 1048: 
 1049: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1050:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1051:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1052:              receive
 1053:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1054:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1055:                               Reciver()
 1056:              end
 1057:      end)().
 1058:     
 1059: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1060:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1061:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1062:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1063:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1064:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1065:     ok.
